decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent's board by using mill effects, removal spells, and counterspells. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by milling their library with cards like Ruin Crab and Soaring Thought-Thief, while also utilizing cards like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act to deal with threats. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to consistently recur low-cost permanents throughout the game. This deck is designed to outlast the opponent and win through attrition.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by milling the opponent's deck with cards like Ruin Crab and Soaring Thought-Thief, while also using cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer to disrupt their strategy. The deck focuses on using counterspells like Drown in the Loch and removal spells like Heartless Act to control the board. The goal is to maintain board control and card advantage with cards like Into the Story, ultimately out-valuing the opponent and winning through a mill victory or by controlling the game until they run out of resources.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing various mill and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to steadily mill the opponent's library using cards like Ruin Crab and into the Story, while also using removal spells like Heartless Act and Bloodchief's Thirst to deal with threats on the board. By controlling the game through milling and removal, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through card advantage and disrupting their game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of disruptive spells and creatures. Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Soaring Thought-Thief, and Merfolk Windrobber provide early game threats while Ruin Crab helps mill the opponent's deck. The deck has a good amount of removal and counterspells to deal with threats, while also gaining card advantage with Into the Story. Agadeem's Awakening can be used to bring back key creatures, and Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing you to cast low-cost permanents from your graveyard.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on mill strategies and graveyard interaction, using cards like Ruin Crab, Soaring Thought-Thief, and Thieves' Guild Enforcer to mill opponents' decks while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue opponents by leveraging the graveyard with cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Call of the Death-Dweller. By consistently milling opponents and utilizing graveyard resources, this deck aims to outlast opponents and win through attrition.

The deck focuses on using a variety of control spells and cards to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. It utilizes cards like Drown in the Loch, Heartless Act, and Lullmage's Domination to remove threats from the opponent's side of the battlefield. It also includes mill cards like Ruin Crab and Thieves' Guild Enforcer to gradually mill the opponent's deck. By controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's plans, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and eventually win the game through card advantage and mill strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to apply early pressure with aggressive creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells like Heartless Act and Drown in the Loch. Gadwick, the Wizened and Zareth San, the Trickster provide additional value and control elements to the deck. The deck also features card draw and recursion options with Into the Story and Agadeem's Awakening. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all necessary colors of mana.

This deck focuses on quickly attacking and disrupting the opponent's game plan with evasive creatures and cheap removal spells. By early aggression and disruption, it aims to control the battlefield and win by dealing consistent damage. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures, counter spells, removal spells, and card draw to maintain pressure on the opponent while controlling the board state. By leveraging Dimir's versatile card pool, it seeks to apply pressure from the start and maintain a dominant position throughout the game.

This Esper Control deck focuses on using Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to maximize value through blinking permanents for additional triggers. It utilizes a mix of removal spells, card draw, and recursion to control the board and outvalue opponents. With a strong suite of enchantments, artifacts, and planeswalkers, this deck aims to grind out games through attrition and overwhelming card advantage. By utilizing various synergies and versatile threats, it aims to outlast opponents and establish a dominating presence on the battlefield.

This control deck focuses on using Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to blink valuable permanents for additional value. The deck includes a variety of removal spells and enchantments to control the board and create incremental advantage. The goal is to outvalue the opponent over time with a combination of card advantage, board control, and resilient threats like Dream Trawler. The deck uses a mix of removal, card draw, and threats to control the game and outlast the opponent in a grindy matchup.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game and outvalue the opponent using various control elements and card advantage. The deck focuses on generating card advantage through cards like Mazemind Tome, Treacherous Blessing, and Omen of the Sea. It also aims to control the board with removal spells like Eliminate, Heartless Act, and Skyclave Apparition. The deck utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as both a companion and a flicker/recurring tool to generate even more value. Ultimately, the goal is to grind out the opponent and win through attrition using powerful finishers like Dance of the Manse and Shark Typhoon.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a variety of removal spells and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key strategy is to generate card advantage and out-value the opponent by looping powerful cards with Yorion, Sky Nomad's blink ability. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant board presence with Dream Trawler and other powerful threats. By carefully managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, Esper Control looks to grind out victories through attrition and overwhelming card advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and enchantments. By utilizing cards like Doom Foretold, Elspeth Conquers Death, and Shark Typhoon, the deck aims to maintain card advantage and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in recurring powerful permanents. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent color access to support the deck's multicolored spells. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game and overwhelm opponents with its powerful late-game threats.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using a mix of removal spells, enchantments, and creatures to disrupt your opponent's game plan. With Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, you can flicker your permanents for continuous value and card advantage. The deck is built around generating value through ETB triggers and card draw, while also having the ability to wipe the board with sweepers like Shatter the Sky and Extinction Event. This deck aims to outvalue and outlast your opponent to secure victory in the late game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a high number of removal spells and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By playing Yorion as a companion, the deck takes advantage of its ability to blink multiple permanents, generating additional value from cards like Skyclave Apparition and Glass Casket. Dance of the Manse and Elspeth Conquers Death provide recursion for important spells and threats. With a mix of removal, disruption, and card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through control.

The main idea of this deck is to control the board through removal spells and enchantments, while also utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as both a companion and a way to generate value by blinking creatures and permanents. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Skyclave Apparition, Elspeth Conquers Death, and Doom Foretold, while also generating card advantage with cards like Omen of the Sea and Treacherous Blessing. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by constantly generating tokens and recurring key threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures with strong abilities to apply constant pressure on the opponent. By curving out with creatures like Lovestruck Beast, Kazandu Mammoth, and Polukranos, Unchained, the deck aims to establish a threatening board presence early on. Supporting cards like The Great Henge provide additional value and card advantage, while removal spells like Murderous Rider and Bloodchief's Thirst allow for answering opponent threats. The deck also includes some utility cards like Gemrazer and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate to deal with various threats and provide options for different game states.

The deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly with efficient creatures like Kazandu Mammoth, Lovestruck Beast, and Foulmire Knight. It also includes removal spells like Bloodchief's Thirst and Heartless Act to control the opponent's board. The inclusion of powerful cards like Vivien, Monsters' Advocate and The Great Henge helps generate card advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and versatile removal spells to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures quickly and efficiently, using cards like Questing Beast, Lovestruck Beast, and Bonecrusher Giant to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With support from cards like Embercleave and Shatterskull Smashing, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Scavenging Ooze and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate provide additional utility and card advantage, while Fabled Passage helps fix mana and thin out the deck. The overall goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out games as quickly as possible.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly deploy threats on the board and apply pressure to the opponent. With a mix of powerful creatures and aggressive spells like Embercleave and Scorching Dragonfire, this deck looks to overwhelm the opponent with efficient and fast-paced plays. The use of cards like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant provide value and flexibility in combat, while The Great Henge serves as a powerful engine for card advantage and mana ramp. Ultimately, this deck aims to win the game through aggressive creature beats and combat tricks.

The focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly deploy aggressive threats such as Questing Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Lovestruck Beast, supported by powerful combat tricks like Embercleave. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early and maintain it throughout the game, utilizing cards like Rimrock Knight and Brushfire Elemental to deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of The Great Henge provides additional card advantage and life gain, while Shatterskull Smashing offers removal options. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to both green and red mana sources.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. By utilizing cards like Rimrock Knight, Bonecrusher Giant, and Embercleave, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Scavenging Ooze and The Great Henge helps to provide additional value and resilience in longer matches. Additionally, the deck includes plenty of mana sources and land searching cards like Fabled Passage to ensure a smooth curve and consistent plays. Overall, this deck thrives on early aggression and high-powered creatures to secure victory.

This deck focuses on playing powerful and efficient creatures like Questing Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Brushfire Elemental to pressure the opponent and deal damage quickly. It also includes cards like The Great Henge and Embercleave to further enhance the strength of the board. The deck aims to establish early dominance on the battlefield, using cards like Lovestruck Beast and Kazandu Mammoth to generate value and maintain pressure. Vivien, Monsters' Advocate provides card advantage and flexibility, while Shatterskull Smashing and Scorching Dragonfire deal with opposing threats. The deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with relentless aggression and efficient plays.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Questing Beast and Lovestruck Beast, while utilizing card advantage from Edgewall Innkeeper. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful equipment like Embercleave. The inclusion of removal spells like Scorching Dragonfire and Shatterskull Smashing helps to control the board and push through damage. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan with a mix of lands that provide the necessary colors and consistency.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the board with aggressive creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Lovestruck Beast to apply pressure on the opponent. By utilizing powerful cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge, it aims to end the game quickly by dealing massive damage. Additionally, cards like Questing Beast and Bonecrusher Giant provide versatile threats that can disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes removal spells like Scorching Dragonfire to deal with threats from the opponent, while cards like Vivien, Monsters' Advocate provide card advantage and additional threats. The mana base is built to support the deck's aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this deck revolves around quickly overwhelming your opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By combining powerful creatures like Questing Beast and Lovestruck Beast with value engines like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge, you can maintain pressure on your opponent while also generating card advantage. The deck also utilizes land ramp and mana fixing with cards like Kazandu Mammoth and Evolving Wilds to ensure that you can consistently play your threats on curve. Overall, the strategy of this deck is to beat down your opponent quickly and efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to put constant pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Questing Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Brushfire Elemental. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and ramp up with cards like Edgewall Innkeeper, Kazandu Mammoth, and The Great Henge. Embercleave provides additional burst damage, while Vivien, Monsters' Advocate helps to generate more threats. The mana base is set up to ensure consistent mana production for the deck's aggressive strategy.

The key concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Bonecrusher Giant to pressure the opponent. The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. By playing efficient threats like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant, while utilizing powerful cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and end the game quickly. Overall, this Gruul Aggro deck prioritizes speed and aggression to secure wins in a Standard 1 vs 1 format.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent with a constant stream of efficient threats. By utilizing creatures with powerful abilities such as Questing Beast and Lovestruck Beast, along with supporting spells like Embercleave and Primal Might, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to establish a fast and aggressive board presence, utilizing powerful creatures like Questing Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Lovestruck Beast to apply early pressure on the opponent. The key concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing efficient creatures and powerful spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck focuses on playing impactful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Lovestruck Beast, and Questing Beast to deal significant damage and control the board. Support cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge provide card draw and additional value. With a mix of efficient creatures, powerful spells like Embercleave, and a solid mana base, the deck aims to maintain a strong and aggressive presence throughout the game.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures and efficient removal spells. By playing aggressively with cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Brushfire Elemental, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Embercleave allow for added power and resilience in the late game. The deck also includes some support from cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate to help maintain card advantage and provide additional threats.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing efficient creatures like Questing Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Lovestruck Beast. It also includes powerful spells like Embercleave and Shatterskull Smashing to finish off the opponent quickly. The deck aims to establish board presence early and keep the pressure on with a mix of creatures and burn spells. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Scavenging Ooze provide additional support and resilience against control decks. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through consistent and aggressive attacks.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control of the game by countering spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage through cards like Mazemind Tome and Midnight Clock. The deck also aims to stall the game until it can play powerful late-game spells like Kiora Bests the Sea God and Shark Typhoon. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and powerful finishers, this Izzet Control deck is designed to outlast opponents and win through carefully managing resources and disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by playing fast and efficient creatures, including Feasting Troll King, Questing Beast, and Wicked Wolf. The deck also includes cards that help ramp up mana production, such as Kazandu Mammoth and Gilded Goose. To ensure consistency and card advantage, the deck features Trail of Crumbs and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with strong creatures and use cards like Ram Through for removal to secure victory.

The deck utilizes a mix of powerful creatures and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive, efficient threats. By ramping quickly with cards like Gilded Goose and Wolfwillow Haven, the deck can play its large threats like Feasting Troll King and Lovestruck Beast ahead of schedule. The trail of Crumbs, Bonders' Enclave, and Castle Garenbrig provide card draw and mana fixing to ensure a consistent stream of threats. The Great Henge acts as a powerful engine, gaining life and adding mana whenever creatures enter the battlefield, further solidifying the deck's aggressive game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using powerful board wipes and removal spells to keep the opponent's creatures at bay. The key strategy is to ramp up quickly with cards like Irencrag Feat and use Ugin, the Spirit Dragon as a game-ending finisher. The deck also includes ways to draw cards and recur threats from the graveyard to outvalue the opponent. Overall, this Mono Red Control deck aims to outlast the opponent while steadily building towards victory.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. Cards like Claim the Firstborn and Woe Strider allow for controlling the board by stealing enemy creatures or sacrificing your own for value. Village Rites and Tymaret Calls the Dead provide card advantage, while Shatterskull Smashing and Hagra Mauling offer removal options. The deck also utilizes graveyard recursion with Ox of Agonas and Kroxa. The goal is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and maintain card advantage to secure victory.

The key concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively control the board while dealing damage to the opponent. The deck relies on a mix of powerful creatures such as Bonecrusher Giant, Kroxa, and Rankle, along with disruptive spells like Claim the Firstborn and Bloodchief's Thirst. The deck also has a self-milling strategy with cards like Woe Strider and Tymaret Calls the Dead, allowing for additional value and graveyard recursion. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain control throughout the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays, utilizing powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Robber of the Rich, and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to quickly pressure the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Murderous Rider and Rankle, Master of Pranks to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of removal spells and graveyard recursion from cards like Tymaret Calls the Dead and Ox of Agonas, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game swiftly.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively attack the opponent using efficient creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to curve out with powerful threats like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Rankle, Master of Pranks to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes ways to generate card advantage and grind out wins in the late game with cards like Woe Strider and Tymaret Calls the Dead. With a mix of aggression and resilience, this Rakdos Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents through efficient threats and disruptive plays.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and removal spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. It includes cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to apply pressure, as well as removal spells like Murderous Rider and Eliminate to deal with threats. Additionally, the deck includes graveyard recursion with Ox of Agonas and Tymaret Calls the Dead to maintain resources and keep up the pressure. The goal of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and efficient removal spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive tactics and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and removal spells. The goal is to quickly put pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats like Kroxa, Robber of the Rich, and Bonecrusher Giant, while using removal spells like Bloodchief's Thirst and Eliminate to deal with opposing threats. The deck also leverages the graveyard with cards like Ox of Agonas and Tymaret Calls the Dead to gain additional value and maintain resources. The deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Rakdos Control deck is to maintain board control through removal spells like Heartless Act and Scorching Dragonfire, while utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to dominate the late game. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Mazemind Tome and Solemn Simulacrum to ensure consistent draws and resources. Additionally, the deck includes finishers like Shatterskull Smashing and Ox of Agonas to close out games. Overall, the deck aims to control the game state and outvalue the opponent until it can secure a win.

The deck focuses on using removal spells and board wipes to control the opponent's creatures, while also using card draw and ramp to maintain card advantage and play powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. It aims to control the pace of the game and out-value the opponent's resources. The deck also includes graveyard recursion with Ox of Agonas for additional card advantage. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to all necessary colors and support the deck's high-cost spells.

This Aggro Red Deck Wins deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By using powerful creatures like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Anax, Hardened in the Forge, alongside efficient removal like Bonecrusher Giant and Shock, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The deck also includes cards like Embercleave and Phoenix of Ash to provide additional damage and evasion. With a low mana curve and a focus on dealing damage, this deck looks to finish games quickly before opponents can stabilize.

The focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively play creatures and burn spells to deal damage to the opponent's life total as fast as possible. Cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Anax, Hardened in the Forge boost the power of red spells and creatures, while Embercleave can provide a huge power boost to a creature for a game-winning strike. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize and counterattack. The deck prioritizes speed, aggression, and efficiency in dealing damage.

This deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays and overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of efficient creatures and powerful burn spells. The deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, using cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Anax, Hardened in the Forge to maximize damage output. Embercleave provides a powerful finishing blow, while cards like Robber of the Rich and Phoenix of Ash generate card advantage and keep up the pressure. The deck is designed to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize or mount a comeback.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing creatures with hasty abilities and direct damage spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Key cards include Torbran, which boosts all red sources of damage, Embercleave, which enhances a creature's power and grants it abilities, and Castle Embereth, which provides additional power to creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a continual stream of threats and burn spells, ending the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive strategy using creatures like Wicked Wolf, Bronzehide Lion, and Skyclave Apparition to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Trail of Crumbs and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate providing additional support and card advantage, the deck aims to maintain a constant stream of threats while also having control elements like Glass Casket and Elspeth Conquers Death to deal with opposing threats. Yorion, Sky Nomad helps to maximize the deck's potential by blinking valuable creatures and generating advantage.

The key concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to establish early board presence and aggression by utilizing various low-cost creatures such as Gilded Goose, Llanowar Visionary, and Charming Prince. The deck focuses on generating value through enter-the-battlefield effects with cards like Skyclave Apparition and Glass Casket to control the opponent's board. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as both a finisher and a way to flicker creatures for additional value. The deck also includes some removal options like Wicked Wolf and Elspeth Conquers Death, while maintaining card advantage through Trail of Crumbs and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a well-rounded mix of creatures and control elements.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and powerful landfall triggers. It aims to quickly develop a strong board presence through cards like Lotus Cobra, Yasharn, and Felidar Retreat. The deck also utilizes disruptive elements like Skyclave Apparition and Glass Casket to remove threats from the opponent's side of the battlefield. The inclusion of Scute Swarm provides additional threats and allows for exponential growth over time. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a fast pace while ramping mana and creating an intimidating board state.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly play out low-cost creatures to apply early pressure on the opponent. By utilizing cards like Faerie Guidemother and Lovestruck Beast, along with the card draw engine provided by Edgewall Innkeeper, the deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Skyclave Apparition. The inclusion of powerful finishers like The Great Henge and Emeria's Call ensures that the deck can continue to apply pressure and win the game in the mid to late game.

The primary focus of this deck is to maintain control of the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to counter and remove threats while generating card advantage through cards like Into the Story and Shark Typhoon. By efficiently managing resources and controlling the board with cards like Brazen Borrower and Heartless Act, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and ultimately win the game through a combination of tempo swings and card advantage.

This deck focuses on using control spells and mill effects to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gaining card advantage through cards like Into the Story and Cling to Dust. Key cards like Ruin Crab and Soaring Thought-Thief enable mill strategies, while Thieves' Guild Enforcer provides additional mill potential and pressure. Lurrus of the Dream-Den acts as a valuable companion, allowing for recursion of key cards and providing additional value throughout the game. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent through control, disruption, and mill effects.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through constant removal, counterspells, and mill effects. It heavily relies on controlling the board with cards like Drown in the Loch and Lullmage's Domination while setting up an aggressive mill strategy with Ruin Crab and other mill cards. By combining efficient removal spells with a disruptive mill strategy, the deck aims to control the game's pace and win condition, ultimately outlasting the opponent through attrition and careful resource management.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by utilizing various counterspells, removal spells, and card draw effects to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to play a long game, eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful late-game threats like Dream Trawler and Yorion, Sky Nomad. The deck also includes alternative win conditions like milling the opponent with Glimpse of Freedom and Mystic Subdual. By stabilizing the board, generating card advantage, and having versatile answers for threats, the deck seeks to grind out a victory against most opponents.

The deck focuses on long-term control and board presence by utilizing a wide range of removal spells, counterspells, and enchantments. It emphasizes card advantage and resource management to outlast opponents in the late game. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value by flickering permanents for incremental advantage. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant position with powerful threats like Dream Trawler and Fae of Wishes, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with targeted removal spells and counters.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and board wipes to keep the opponent's threats in check. The focus is on generating card advantage and maintaining board presence with cards like Omen of the Sea and Elspeth Conquers Death. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as a powerful companion and allows for additional value by flickering permanents. The deck also aims to win through a slow and steady approach by grinding out the opponent with incremental advantage until it can close out the game with powerful finishers like Shark Typhoon and Crawling Barrens.

The deck focuses on a fast, aggressive playstyle by utilizing low-cost creatures in the Weenie White archetype. It aims to flood the board with small creatures like Selfless Savior, Speaker of the Heavens, and Luminarch Aspirant, while also benefiting from lifegain synergies with Linden, the Steadfast Queen and Heliod, Sun-Crowned. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a Companion allows for recursion of key creatures, maintaining pressure on opponents. The deck also includes removal options like Skyclave Apparition and offers some flexibility with cards like Charming Prince.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan with a variety of removal spells, enchantments, and creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Yorion, Sky Nomad. The deck utilizes cards like Doom Foretold and Elspeth Conquers Death to generate value and hinder the opponent's resources. With a mix of board wipes, card draw, and recursion, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and establish control of the game until it can win with powerful late-game threats.
